quote: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
together: "A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out." --Walter Winchell

quote: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
together: "The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it." --Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
together: "One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives." --Euripides

quote: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
together: "Friends are the siblings God never gave us." --Mencius

quote: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
together: "A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else." --Len Wein

quote: Things are never quite as scary when you've got a best friend.
together: "Things are never quite as scary when you've got a best friend." --Bill Watterson

quote: It takes a long time to grow an old friend.
together: "It takes a long time to grow an old friend." --John Leonard

quote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
together: "One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood." --Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
together: "The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity." --Ulysses S. Grant

quote: The best time to make friends is before you need them.
together: "The best time to make friends is before you need them." --Ethel Barrymore

quote: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.
together: "It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter." --Marlene Dietrich

quote: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind.
together: "She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind." --Toni Morrison

quote: Lovers have a right to betray you... friends don't.
together: "Lovers have a right to betray you... friends don't." --Judy Holliday

quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
together: "There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met." --William Butler Yeats

quote: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
together: "There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship." --Thomas Aquinas

quote: Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go.
together: "Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go." --Margaret Walker

quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
together: "No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow." --Alice Walker

quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
together: "Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom." --Marcel Proust

quote: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.
together: "Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best." --John Webster

quote: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
together: "I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun." --Charles R. Swindoll

quote: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
together: "True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost." --Charles Caleb Colton

quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
together: "The only way to have a friend is to be one." --Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
together: "Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness." --Euripides

quote: Yes'm, old friends is always best, 'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.
together: "Yes'm, old friends is always best, 'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of." --Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
together: "The world is round so that friendship may encircle it." --Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quote: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
together: "Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief." --Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
together: "Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over." --Octavia E. Butler

quote: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
together: "True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing." --Baltasar Gracian

quote: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
together: "A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth." --Charles Darwin

quote: If you have one true friend you have more than your share.
together: "If you have one true friend you have more than your share." --Thomas Fuller

quote: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
together: "Friendship is one mind in two bodies." --Mencius

quote: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
together: "A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!" --Doug Larson

quote: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
together: "In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed." --Khalil Gibran

quote: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend.
together: "Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend." --Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
together: "Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer." --Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.
together: "Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them." --Francesco Guicciardini

quote: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
together: "Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil." --Baltasar Gracian

quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
together: "Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing." --Elie Wiesel

quote: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.
together: "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand." --Henri Nouwen

quote: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
together: "Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway." --Elbert Hubbard

quote: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
together: "In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit." --Albert Schweitzer

quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
together: "Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born." --Anais Nin

quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
together: "I have learned that to be with those I like is enough." --Walt Whitman

quote: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
together: "I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better." --Plutarch

quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
together: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." --Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.
together: "The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship." --William Blake

quote: A friend to all is a friend to none.
together: "A friend to all is a friend to none." --Aristotle

quote: You find out who your real friends are when you're involved in a scandal.
together: "You find out who your real friends are when you're involved in a scandal." --Elizabeth Taylor

quote: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
together: "The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares." --Henri Nouwen

quote: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
together: "There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you." --Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
together: "Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends." --Shirley MacLaine

quote: When you choose your friends, don't be short-changed by choosing personality over character.
together: "When you choose your friends, don't be short-changed by choosing personality over character." --W. Somerset Maugham

quote: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.
together: "I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend." --Thomas Jefferson

quote: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
together: "Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart." --Washington Irving

quote: Friends are born, not made.
together: "Friends are born, not made." --Henry Adams

quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
together: "Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down." --Oprah Winfrey

quote: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
together: "A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world." --Leo Buscaglia

quote: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.
together: "Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins." --Charles Eastman

quote: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
together: "A friend is a gift you give yourself." --Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
together: "A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same." --Elbert Hubbard
